channel.title: Chronos - New RS2 Server Framework
channel.description:
Visit the CodePlex page for the download, documentation, issue tracking, etc: http://rs2chronos.codeplex.com/
This is the new version of my project. You can believe that it is better than my first ten-fold. (NOTE: This is not based on the previous project, this is from scratch)
Current features:
[ul][li]Completely scalable, easy for "newbies" to understand.[/li] [li]Documented better than the casual opensource project.[/li] [li]Dedicated development/coordination team.[/li] [li]Dynamic packet handling, easy for quick version changes or packet handling.[/li] [li]Benchmarker class for simple benchmarking (demonstrated in the source code).[/li] [li]Netty implementation.[/li] [li]Entity-based inheritance.[/li] [li]Two example packet handlers: SessionKeyRequestPacketHandler, UserAuthenticationPacketHandler.[/li] [li]Eclipse project files.[/li] [li]Javadoc documentation.[/li] [li]Just look at the sauce, you'll know.[/li][/ul]
Media: [img]http://i50.tinypic.com/fbibnb.jpg[/img] NOTE: The client issue is not server sided. I used the cache from SWAT's full-screen deobfuscated client in a quick attempt to get a picture.

item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

[quote=“xJaws, post:15, topic:340712”][quote author=glestrts link=topic=437082.msg3212587#msg3212587 date=1274393727]

I’m working on getting login fully complete but it’s being an asshole right now. Keep getting T1 errors.

sweet, then you need to send player properties, then handle packets and your nearly done.
<3 man, also grizzly is a bitch to find documentation, only help is that its open source.
[/quote]
I gotta learn Grizzly hehe.[/quote]
same lol, ill try to get binding on a port read some examples lol, need to implement this into hyperion, because mina fails now.

Read full topic

item.title: Chronos - New RS2 Server Framework
item.dc:creator: @xJaws xJaws
item.description:
@xJaws wrote:

[quote=“glestrts, post:6, topic:340712”][quote author=xJaws link=topic=437082.msg3211836#msg3211836 date=1274315339]
I was going to originally use either MINA (didn’t due to apparent performance issues) or Grizzly (didn’t because I didn’t know anything about it), but I just decided to use Netty because I already knew about it, and it was by word of mouth the best choice.

I used their getting started guide, examples, and apidocs to get into it: http://www.jboss.org/netty/documentation.html
[/quote]
Sounds nice, I am planning on getting used to networking Api’s, I really don’t understand Netty’s use of pipelines, so I have a basic Grizzly webserver (not for rsps) that ill probably use as a guide for binding to a port, and other stuff.[/quote]
What do you mean? You don’t understand why it uses a pipeline or you don’t understand them in general?

Read full topic

item.title: Chronos - New RS2 Server Framework
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

[quote=“xJaws, post:5, topic:340712”]I was going to originally use either MINA (didn’t due to apparent performance issues) or Grizzly (didn’t because I didn’t know anything about it), but I just decided to use Netty because I already knew about it, and it was by word of mouth the best choice.

I used their getting started guide, examples, and apidocs to get into it: http://www.jboss.org/netty/documentation.html[/quote]
Sounds nice, I am planning on getting used to networking Api’s, I really don’t understand Netty’s use of pipelines, so I have a basic Grizzly webserver (not for rsps) that ill probably use as a guide for binding to a port, and other stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Chronos - New RS2 Server Framework
item.dc:creator: @xJaws xJaws
item.description:
@xJaws wrote:

glestrts:

Is netty well documented? because im having a hard time finding stuff about grizzly.

I was going to originally use either MINA (didn’t due to apparent performance issues) or Grizzly (didn’t because I didn’t know anything about it), but I just decided to use Netty because I already knew about it, and it was by word of mouth the best choice.

I used their getting started guide, examples, and apidocs to get into it: http://www.jboss.org/netty/documentation.html. It actually helped quite a lot.

Read full topic

Edit: Yes I did look through rsdaemon which inspired me to do some of the things I did.

item.title: Chronos - New RS2 Server Framework
item.dc:creator: @xJaws xJaws
item.description:
@xJaws wrote:

Visit the CodePlex page for the download, documentation, issue tracking, etc: http://rs2chronos.codeplex.com/

This is the new version of my project. You can believe that it is better than my first ten-fold. (NOTE: This is not based on the previous project, this is from scratch)

Current features:

[ul][li]Completely scalable, easy for “newbies” to understand.[/li]
[li]Documented better than the casual opensource project.[/li]
[li]Dedicated development/coordination team.[/li]
[li]Dynamic packet handling, easy for quick version changes or packet handling.[/li]
[li]Benchmarker class for simple benchmarking (demonstrated in the source code).[/li]
[li]Netty implementation.[/li]
[li]Entity-based inheritance.[/li]
[li]Two example packet handlers: SessionKeyRequestPacketHandler, UserAuthenticationPacketHandler.[/li]
[li]Eclipse project files.[/li]
[li]Javadoc documentation.[/li]
[li]Just look at the sauce, you’ll know.[/li][/ul]

Media:

fbibnb.jpg1152×864

NOTE: The client issue is not server sided. I used the cache from SWAT’s full-screen deobfuscated client in a quick attempt to get a picture.
